title: Not working!!!1
body: I tried to do the RP giveaway and the surveys are not letting me have the free riot points.

replies.body: That's because it's a scam.  If you entered your League info anywhere, be sure to change your password now.

> [{quoted}](name=TheCurator,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=zmFLe7ad,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-12-13T03:28:18.272+0000)
>
> That's because it's a scam.  If you entered your League info anywhere, be sure to change your password now.

Hello TheCurator! I sent in a Ticket to Riot Support, but I don't know if they or you can get to this sooner.
Anyways, on the Snowdown Site http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/featured/skins/snowdown-2016, there is a post by a scammer (austinthdbeast) using a tinyurl link to get past the filter. I can't report it, but I can downvote it and manually report it to you, which is what I'm doing.
Keep up the good work!

EDIT: http://nexus.leagueoflegends.com/2016/12/ask-riot-leagues-future-and-luxs-q/ has the same suspicious link from the same suspicious guy.

> [{quoted}](name=Aeszarck,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=zmFLe7ad,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2016-12-16T03:42:04.843+0000)
>
> Hello TheCurator! I sent in a Ticket to Riot Support, but I don't know if they or you can get to this sooner.
> Anyways, on the Snowdown Site http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/featured/skins/snowdown-2016, there is a post by a scammer (austinthdbeast) using a tinyurl link to get past the filter. I can't report it, but I can downvote it and manually report it to you, which is what I'm doing.
> Keep up the good work!
> 
> EDIT: http://nexus.leagueoflegends.com/2016/12/ask-riot-leagues-future-and-luxs-q/ has the same suspicious link from the same suspicious guy.

Thanks for the heads-up.  We know there's an issue with reporting/removing those comments and we'll go through and try to scrub them out.  We've passed it along to Riot as well.

> [{quoted}](name=TheCurator,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=zmFLe7ad,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2016-12-16T23:21:39.573+0000)
>
> Thanks for the heads-up.  We know there's an issue with reporting/removing those comments and we'll go through and try to scrub them out.  We've passed it along to Riot as well.

Thank you for removing them!

Do you mind if I direct you to these users posting malicious links on specialty sites in the future? I feel like you're the best person to ask because you're quite active, but if you want me to contact Keyru or someone else I could do that too.
Did I do the right thing in sending a Ticket to Riot Support? They didn't fully read my reply and asked me to downvote the post (which works, though it's frustrating to only bring the post down to +5 because it was upvote botted) and report it (despite me explicitly stating in my Ticket that I could not report the post because it was on a specialty site and the replies did not link with a convenient Boards thread which would allow me to report them), so I feel like they didn't fully understand the situation and probably couldn't help. I do however remember Deep Terror Nami suggesting that users tell Riot Support about suspicious links that they get, so I thought that they might have been able to help with the situation because this was a case of suspicious links. Should I still send them Tickets in the future to make sure that someone is notified that there's a malicious link that I can't report on a page?

> [{quoted}](name=Aeszarck,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=zmFLe7ad,comment-id=0000000000000000,timestamp=2016-12-16T23:38:28.430+0000)
>
> Thank you for removing them!
> 
> Do you mind if I direct you to these users posting malicious links on specialty sites in the future? I feel like you're the best person to ask because you're quite active, but if you want me to contact Keyru or someone else I could do that too.
> Did I do the right thing in sending a Ticket to Riot Support? They didn't fully read my reply and asked me to downvote the post (which works, though it's frustrating to only bring the post down to +5 because it was upvote botted) and report it (despite me explicitly stating in my Ticket that I could not report the post because it was on a specialty site and the replies did not link with a convenient Boards thread which would allow me to report them), so I feel like they didn't fully understand the situation and probably couldn't help. I do however remember Deep Terror Nami suggesting that users tell Riot Support about suspicious links that they get, so I thought that they might have been able to help with the situation because this was a case of suspicious links. Should I still send them Tickets in the future to make sure that someone is notified that there's a malicious link that I can't report on a page?

If sending in a ticket just results in them telling you to downvote it, then I'd just downvote it and comment like I noted you did there telling people it's a scam.  This is only an issue when the post/mini-site is created and the comments aren't linked directly to the Boards, which has been a rarer occurrence lately.  If you see something like this again in the future, you can simply make a post in Player Behavior & Moderation letting us know the link to the mini-site and that scam site links are getting through there.  Any moderator on duty can take it from there and go remove them.

> [{quoted}](name=TheCurator,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=zmFLe7ad,comment-id=00000000000000000000,timestamp=2016-12-16T23:46:05.846+0000)
>
> If sending in a ticket just results in them telling you to downvote it, then I'd just downvote it and comment like I noted you did there telling people it's a scam.  This is only an issue when the post/mini-site is created and the comments aren't linked directly to the Boards, which has been a rarer occurrence lately.  If you see something like this again in the future, you can simply make a post in Player Behavior & Moderation letting us know the link to the mini-site and that scam site links are getting through there.  Any moderator on duty can take it from there and go remove them.

I will do that!
Thank you, and have a nice day!

Yup, as *TheCurator* mentioned, anything that advertises an "RP Giveaway", "Holiday Event" or anything else that asks for your login information for your League Account and **isn't** on the riotgames domain (somethingsomething.riotgames.com) is pretty sketchy and most likely a scam.

It would be a good idea to change your password as mentioned in this thread already, but also do a quick scan with an Antivirus or malware scanner such as [**Malwarebytes**](https://www.malwarebytes.com/) to ensure that site didn't load something nasty on your PC.

Let me know if you have any other questions.
